text:
Hi <@U036TUPVAV8> - thanks for sharing this idea and sorry that you had this experience!! I really like how you're thinking of helping other folks avoid similar issues in the future.

I'm curious when you say you're build a solution in a sandbox, are you referring to a developer test account or potentially a free CMS sandbox? Could you please share the hubid in which you worked and encountered this issue.

This will help me see what type of account it is so that I can make sure the feedback is funneled to the right team. Thank you :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey Denise, sorry i misspoke.  To clarify, I was building out a theme in what I thought was a "live"/paid portal but turns out it was a trial and that trial was professional.  So i was thinking maybe a banner in the hubdb area while in a trial with something like "Remember: Hubdb is only available for enterprise accounts". I'm sure there are other areas where these sort of notices would be nice as well.  for reference the portal number is 41759331
but I guess this would also apply to sandbox development as well. Maybe if you bring in hubdb via hubl code the transpiler can pick that up and display a warning or something
Gotcha! That makes sense and appreciate the clarification and thought process behind the application of the use case across other account types as well. :raised_hands: thank you!
